author: Pat Storms
comment: For my needs, this is currently just ok.   I think there is huge possibility for me if we can use an action within an application that will do a swipe right or left for example.     This button key app is great to start another application or android function.   But how about some in application functions like the swipe right, or even press a specific location on a screen?  I noticed the Next, Previous actions, but these are for music players and will not do a next function in any other applications, like a web browser for example.    How long would that take to get implemented?   Or am I missing something that already allows this?   Great work so far.   Just needs a bit more for me to fully take advantage of this.

author: Petr Březina
comment: Well, it works.

author: Ken Ahuja
comment: This was the best app to work with the Aux Key especially for Nexus 5 with the power button failure, as it essentially replaced the screen off/on function. BUT ever since the last update, it's become almost useless since the app keeps getting killed. The persistent notification is on but it vanishes even when the screen is off for barely few minutes. Hope it's solved soon since this app has been a life saver until I find the time to get the phone repaired atleast!

author: Fexjo Osx
comment: PLEASE Fix it, i really need it..  It's still running in background (and notification) but when i press my button, it always plays music
What happened.....After the update it doesn't work on my tab s3.... Before it was perfect

author: René Vollmer
comment: Tested 5 of these apps - IMHO this the best app out there for the job. Recognises the clicks and patterns reliably, has a lot of features you can associate to the patterns (though for me it could still be more).  Also works with the 1€ ebay iKey things. Ad-free/pro is only 50cents.

author: Tommy Zhou
comment: Great app for my MiKey!! When I first got the MiKey I tried the official Mikey app and it was really unreliable. Then I stumbled upon this app and now my MiKey works great! Haven't ran into any serious problems yet. This app offers so much functionality. I love that it allows you to use shortcuts because then I can use it to trigger my tasker tasks. Great work man, I'll probably pick up the pro key

it works but if you turn off the screen after several minutes it will not recognize Mikey' s input so it s useless and not so responsive as i want. please improve the app to fix the input loss and reactivity

author: Nikhil Wanpal
comment: It stopped working yet again.. every few updates it stops identifying the button and you find out only when you can't hear anything on a call.. now, it has stopped showing the selection pop-up, no way to identify that this is the button and not headset, you can always 'clear' you response to that pop-up,even you cannot respond to it. It's difficult to get the dev to agree that it's not working...! And I was stupid enough to buy premium key to help the dev.

comment: Really wonderfull app, the UI and design as well standard like google apps.  One of the problem is that the flashlight shortcut is not working,  so the developer need to update new version soon with fix this bug

comment: Only one issue, not getting the popup dialog box asking if it is a mikey as seen in the screenshot. So everytime I want to use my earphones, I have to stop the app. Any ideas?
title: Works great

author: Ranbir Kaur
comment: The only app that worked with my super cheap 3.5mm device.  The only problem is that it doesn't start on boot and that the system driver isn't working without switching it on and off and on again. Then it works as expected.

author: Mehmet Akif TAŞOVA
comment: Switching to Always Headset mode does nothing. App forces you to use every 3.5mm device as a simple button. Always redirects audio to speakers and there is no option to change that
